snippet: Retail sales fell in June, the government said. But JPMorgan and Johnson & Johnson reported results that beat estimates.
abstract: Stocks rise broadly as investors refocus on United States economy and corporate profits.
lead_paragraph: Retail sales fell in June, the government said. But JPMorgan and Johnson & Johnson reported results that beat estimates.

headline.main: Market Adds to Winning Streak as Investors Shrug Off Weak Data
headline.print_headline: Strong Earnings in U.S. Help Market Ward Off Greece and China Blues
